text: Nicolino Locche (September 2, 1939 - September 7, 2005) was an Argentine professional boxer from Tunuy√°n, Mendoza who held the World Junior Welterweight title from 1968 to 1972. Locche turned professional at the age of 19 and amassed a record of 117-4-14 (14 draws).https://boxrec.com/en/proboxer/10279 He had several successful defenses including one over Antonio Cervantes. Regarded as one of the greatest defensive boxers of all time,https://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/nicolino-locche-506432.html his way of frustrating his foes with a minimum of head movement and avoiding most of their punches earned him the moniker 'El Intocable' (the Untouchable). He was inducted into the International Boxing Hall Of Fame in 2003. Locche died in Las Heras in 2005 of heart failure. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2005 deaths Category:Argentine boxers
title: Nicolino Locche
